name: Kostas Magoutis
content: Kostas Magoutis research teaching publications students service distinctions and awards about/contact Kostas Magoutis Professor and Chair Computer Science Department University of Crete Heraklion, Crete, Greece Information for prospective MSc/PhD students: The University of Crete graduate programs in Computer Science invite applications from exceptional candidates twice a year (deadlines March 31 and October 31). Research My research interests revolve around the following areas: Distributed computer systems Autonomic service management Quantum-enhanced computing systems Scalable event-based systems, Internet of Things (IoT) Cloud computing, lifecycle management of multi-cloud applications Read more about my research This is a partial list of projects I have participated in over the years: The QUADS project (2025-2028) funded by a H.F.R.I faculty grant, aims for quantum-enhancement of adaptive computer systems at different system scales The GreenInCities project (2024-2027) funded by Horizon Europe aims for urban regeneration through participatory and sustainable greening solutions for all The STREAMSTORE project (2020-2023) funded by a H.F.R.I. faculty grant, improves the state of the art in elastic, scalable, and highly available stateful stream processing systems The Interconnected Smart Cities for Greece 2.0 (2023-2025) funded by national and EU agencies aims to develop a federated platform that interconnects IoT data silos across smart cities The SmartCityBus project (2020-2023) developed an IoT-driven intelligent public transportation platform The SocioCoast project (2021-2023) funded through Interreg V-A Greece-Cyprus contributes to better quality coasts via the use of crowdsourcing and big-data technologies The Proximiot project (2019-2023) developed a smart IoT-driven proximity marketing platform The ProxiTour project (2018-2022) developed a smart IoT-driven personalized touring platform The PaaSage European FP7 collaborative project (2012-2016) delivered an open and integrated platform to support model based lifecycle management of Cloud applications The ScaleWorks FP7 project (2009-2011) contributed to the improvement of the entire lifecycle of scalable distributed systems from design to engineering, prototyping, deployment, and operation, on contemporary cost-effective high-performance platforms The Galapagos project (2006-2009) at IBM Research contributed a model-based approach to distributed systems management with a focus on data and storage. Research on the structure and performance of the Direct Access File System at Harvard (2000-2004) received two best paper awards and helped shape industrial standardization efforts around direct-access (RDMA) interconnects Teaching (full list) University of Crete HY-452 - Introduction to the Science and Technology of Services (Fall 2025) University of Crete HY-559 - Infrastructure Technologies for Large-Scale Service-Oriented Systems (Fall 2025) University of Crete HY-590.45 - Modern Topics in Scalable Storage Systems (Spring 2026) Recent Publications (full list) Proportional Fairness and Isolation for Serverless Applications over FaaS Platforms George Kelantonakis, Fallia Kourou and Kostas Magoutis In Proceedings of the 16th ACM/SPEC International Conference on Performance Engineering (ICPE'25), May 5-9, Toronto, Canada (pdf) Model Predictive Control of Internet Servers using Quantum Annealing Efthymios Papageorgiou, George T. Further information about my publications is also available online at DBLP and Google Scholar. I have also authored a number of patents.
